channel.title: Florence Nightingale on Stat 150 at Cal Poly

item.title: Florence Nightingale (2)
item.description: “The world is put back by the death of everyone who has to sacrifice the development of his or her peculiar gifts to conventionality.” - Florence Nightingale Florence Nightingale is a prominent figure in the nursing world, well known for her work during the Crimean war and for founding the first professional nursing school in the world. Nightingale worked with the British government to improve sanitation in field hospitals, while also improving nutrition and acquiring more medical supplies for the soldiers.
